item.content:encoded: Finally in print! The idea of writing a paper about the minimum wage was pretty scary. I'm glad we did. We learned a lot. We hope you do too! The appendix and replication package, including tex files is on my website. Thanks to @ChadJonesEcon, who was an excellent editor.
item.author: Simon Mongey

item.content:encoded: MasterCard has now outperformed both Apple and Amazon since it's 2006 IPO. Somehow still seems underappreciated.

item.content:encoded: It's finally here: ABUNDANCE, the new book I wrote with @ezraklein, is out March 18. I am so excited for people to read this book‚Äîand if you're in NYC, DC, Boston, SF, LA, Los Altos, Chicago (or Seattle, Atlanta, Raleigh, Portland...), I'm excited to talk to you this spring.

item.content:encoded: Tokens per second is more important to the user experience with reasoning models like R1 that improve their capabilities by increasing the number of output tokens as a function of test-time compute. Impressive result from @CerebrasSystems Yes, biased here.

item.content:encoded: A Winter Weather Advisory has been issued above 6500 ft. from Friday AM to Sunday AM for snow totals of 11-18 inches, higher along the peaks. Prepare for slippery and snow-covered roads, travel delays, and chain controls if planning mountainous travel this weekend. #CAwx

If 20% of its income is out the door with zero benefit to shareholders, only to, employees as of last Q that's SALARY EXPENSE. It's true margin is sub 30%

item.content:encoded: 1/ This internal 2007 Nokia presentation on the first iPhone is a really good example of how incumbents actually get disrupted Oftentimes, the incumbent already knows what needs to be done. It's just that organizational incentives inhibit the incumbent from doing it

item.content:encoded: In a large US sample, approximately half of all women discontinue antidepressant usage during pregnancy (no change in usage for spouses). This is in a new paper that I just published with @claireeboone and @ccolina_pe that is primarily descriptive.
